sentences: Kõigepealt tuleb õppida kasutama päästikut ja siis päästikule.
context: The word 'päästikule' is in the allative case, meaning it shows direction toward something. It's derived from 'päästik' (trigger/button) + '-le' (allative case ending). This form indicates movement or action directed toward a trigger or button. In Estonian grammar, this would be used when you're talking about moving toward or acting upon a trigger/button.
